verses.text: And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomonâ€™s reign over Israel, in the month Zif, which \add is\add* the second month, that he \add began\add* to build the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the house which king Solomon built for the \sc Lord\sc*, the length thereof \add was\add* threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty \add cubits\add*, and the height thereof thirty cubits.

And the porch before the temple of the house, twenty cubits \add was\add* the length thereof, according to the breadth of the house; \add and\add* ten cubits \add was\add* the breadth thereof before the house.
And for the house he made windows of narrow lights.

And against the wall of the house he built chambers round about, \add against\add* the walls of the house round about, \add both\add* of the temple and of the oracle: and he made chambers round about:

the nethermost chamber \add was\add* five cubits broad, and the middle \add was\add* six cubits broad, and the third \add was\add* seven cubits broad: for without \add in the wall\add* of the house he made narrowed rests round about, that \add the beams\add* should not be fastened in the walls of the house.

And the house, when it was in building, was built \add of\add* stone made ready \add before it was\add* brought \add thither:\add* so that there was neither hammer nor axe \add nor\add* any tool of iron heard in the house, while it was in building.
The door for the middle chamber \add was\add* in the right side of the house: and they went up with winding stairs into the middle \add chamber\add*, and out of the middle into the third.
So he built the house, and finished it; and covered the house with beams and boards of cedar.
And \add then\add* he built chambers against all the house, five cubits high: and they rested on the house with timber of cedar.
And the word of the \sc Lord\sc* came to Solomon, saying,

\add Concerning\add* this house which thou art in building, if thou wilt walk in my statutes, and execute my judgments, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I perform my word with thee, which I spake unto David thy father:
and I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will not forsake my people Israel.
So Solomon built the house, and finished it.

And he built the walls of the house within with boards of cedar, both the floor of the house, and the walls of the cieling: \add and\add* he covered \add them\add* on the inside with wood, and covered the floor of the house with planks of fir.

And he built twenty cubits on the sides of the house, both the floor and the walls with boards of cedar: he even built \add them\add* for it within, \add even\add* for the oracle, \add even\add* for the most holy \add place\add*.
And the house, that \add is\add*, the temple before it, was forty cubits \add long\add*.
And the cedar of the house within \add was\add* carved with knops and open flowers: all \add was\add* cedar; there was no stone seen.
And the oracle he prepared in the house within, to set there the ark of the covenant of the \sc Lord\sc*.

And the oracle in the forepart \add was\add* twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth, and twenty cubits in the height thereof: and he overlaid it with pure gold; and \add so\add* covered the altar \add which was of\add* cedar.
So Solomon overlaid the house within with pure gold: and he made a partition by the chains of gold before the oracle; and he overlaid it with gold.
And the whole house he overlaid with gold, until \add he\add* had finished all the house: also the whole altar that \add was\add* by the oracle he overlaid with gold.
And within the oracle he made two cherubims \add of\add* olive tree, each ten cubits high.

And five cubits \add was\add* the one wing of the cherub, and five cubits the other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing unto the uttermost part of the other \add were\add* ten cubits.
And the other cherub \add was\add* ten cubits: both the cherubims \add were\add* of one measure and one size.
The height of the one cherub \add was\add* ten cubits, and so \add was it\add* of the other cherub.

And he set the cherubims within the inner house: and they stretched forth the wings of the cherubims, so that the wing of the one touched the \add one\add* wall, and the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall; and their wings touched one another in the midst of the house.
And he overlaid the cherubims with gold.
And he carved all the walls of the house round about \add with\add* carved figures of cherubims and palm trees and open flowers, within and without.
And the floor of the house he overlaid with gold, within and without.
And for the entering of the oracle he made doors of olive tree: the lintel \add and\add* side posts \add were\add* a fifth \add part of the wall\add*.

The two doors also \add were\add* of olive tree; and he carved upon them carvings of cherubims and palm trees and open flowers, and overlaid \add them\add* with gold, and spread gold upon the cherubims, and upon the palm trees.
So also made he for the door of the temple posts of olive tree, a fourth \add part of the wall\add*.
And the two doors \add were\add* of fir tree: the two leaves of the one door \add were\add* folding, and the two leaves of the other door \add were\add* folding.
And he carved \add thereon\add* cherubims and palm trees and open flowers: and covered \add them\add* with gold fitted upon the carved work.
And he built the inner court \add with\add* three rows of hewed stone, and a row of cedar beams.
In the fourth year was the foundation of the house of the \sc Lord\sc* laid, in the month Zif:

and in the eleventh year, in the month Bul, which \add is\add* the eighth month, was the house finished throughout all the parts thereof, and according to all the fashion of it. So was he seven years in building it.
